data.title: Ha Dong-kyun - Grokipedia
data.snippet: Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), professionally known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter recognized for his distinctive husky voice and emotive power ballads. Active in the K-pop industry for over two decades, he has built a career spanning group performances, solo releases, and television appearances, earning acclaim for his vocal depth and songwriting. Ha began his music career in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, which disbanded shortly after debut. In 2004, he joined the YG Entertainment group Wanted, releasing their debut album before the group entered a three-year hiatus following the tragic death of member Seo Jae-hyo in a car accident. Transitioning to a solo path, Ha released his debut studio album Stand Alone in 2006, followed by [...] Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Jungnang-gu, Seoul, South Korea. Public information about his immediate family is limited, but he was raised by his parents alongside an older sister. This modest family background in a Seoul neighborhood appears to have fostered his relatable and grounded public persona, though specific details on his parents' occupations or home life are not widely documented. From a young age, Ha Dong-kyun showed an affinity for music, particularly rock, which he listened to avidly and even performed as a vocalist in a high school rock band—marking his initial forays into singing without any mention of formal training at that stage. These early local influences in Seoul helped shape his passion for music, setting the foundation for his later career pursuits. [...] engages with fans through social media, maintaining an active Instagram account (@ha.d.qn) where he shares glimpses of his daily life, behind-the-scenes music production, and personal reflections. His hobbies include listening to music, driving, and playing computer games, which provide him outlets for relaxation outside his professional commitments.

data.title: Dong-Kyun Ha - Grokipedia
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry.   Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years.   His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition [...] ## Early life

### Early years and background

Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, South Korea, specifically in the Jungnang-gu district (formerly part of Dongdaemun-gu).  His zodiac sign is Cancer, and he is Protestant Christian.  Early profiles list his height as 175 cm and blood type as O.  From childhood, Ha Dong-kyun developed a passion for music, particularly rock and heavy metal genres, listening to bands such as Whitesnake and Mr. Big while participating in rock bands during his youth.  These early experiences nurtured his dream of becoming a musician before his professional entry into the industry in 2002. 

## Career

### 2002–2005: Group debut with 7Dayz and Wanted [...] Ha Dong-kyun has frequently appeared as a performer, contestant, or guest on South Korean music competition shows, variety programs, and performance-based television formats, highlighting his vocal prowess and engaging personality.   In 2019, he joined as a regular member of the second lineup for The Call Season 2, a collaborative music variety show that paired artists for performances.  He continued this trend in 2023 by serving as a regular cast member on Begin Again Season 5: Intermission, a program featuring acoustic performances and musical interactions.  More recently, in 2024, Ha Dong-kyun appeared on Song Stealer as a Song Stealer in two episodes and as a performer on SynchroU in one episode.   He has also made guest appearances on long-running talk and music variety shows,

data.title: Ha Dong-kyun
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), officially known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter. He debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, before joining the boy band Wanted "Wanted (South Korean band)") in 2004. As a solo singer, he has released two albums: Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), and three extended plays: Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).

## Career

Musical artist

In this Korean name, the family name is  Ha "Ha (Korean surname)"). [...] Dong Qn embarked on his career as a solo singer with the release of his first album Stand Alone in 2006. He has since followed his debut album with the release of his second full-length album Another Corner (2008) as well as multiple singles and mini albums including Mark (2012) and Word (2014). Dong Qn attracted substantial audience attention from his appearance on a popular South Korean singing competition TV program I Am a Singer (Season 3, aired in 2015). In 2016, Ha Dong Qn founded the independent record label Mark Planet, under which he then released his new mini album Polygon, consisting of five single tracks, on May 11, 2017. Getting rave reviews for his new album, he held a very successful first solo concert Night: The First on June 4, 2017, and continued advancing his career by
